com.myscript.atk.scw

Interface SingleCharWidgetApi


  • public interface SingleCharWidgetApi
    This interface describes the public API of the single character widget component.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  SingleCharWidgetApi.OnConfigureListener
      Interface definition for callbacks to be invoked at the beginning and end of a handwriting configuration process.
      static interface  SingleCharWidgetApi.OnGestureListener
      Interface definition for callbacks to be invoked when gestures are detected.
      static interface  SingleCharWidgetApi.OnRecognitionListener
      Interface definition for callbacks to be invoked at the beginning and end of a recognition session.
      static interface  SingleCharWidgetApi.OnTextChangedListener
      Interface definition for a callback to be invoked when the text changes.

        void setInkColor(int color)
        Set the color of the ink.
        Parameters:
        color - Color of the ink.

      • setInkWidth

        void setInkWidth(float width)
        Set the width of the ink.
        Parameters:
        width - Width of the ink in pixels.

      • setInkEffect

        void setInkEffect(int effect)
        Set the rendering effect applied to the ink.
        Parameters:
        effect - Rendering effect type.

      • setInkCapResources

        void setInkCapResources(int startId,
                      int endId)
        Set the appearance of the start and end caps of an ink stroke.

        This only applies to the board marker rendering effect.

        Parameters:
        startId - Resource identifier of the start cap of a stroke.
        endId - Resource identifier of the end cap of a stroke.
        See Also:
        setInkEffect(int)

      • setInkFadeOutDelay

        void setInkFadeOutDelay(int delay)
        Set the delay after which strokes start fading out.
        Parameters:
        delay - Fade-out delay in milliseconds.

      • setInkFadeOutDuration

        void setInkFadeOutDuration(int duration)
        Set the duration of the strokes fading out.
        Parameters:
        duration - Fade-out duration in milliseconds.

      • setAutoCommitDelay

        void setAutoCommitDelay(int delay)
        Set the delay after which handwriting recognition starts for the character being written (in isolated mode). The value should be between 100 and 10000ms. The default value is 500ms.
        Parameters:
        delay - Auto-commit delay in milliseconds.

      • setAutoFreezeDelay

        void setAutoFreezeDelay(int delay)
        Set the delay after which strokes are automatically frozen. The value should be between 100 and 10000ms. the default value is 3000ms.
        Parameters:
        delay - Auto-freeze delay in milliseconds.

      • setMaxWordCandidatesCount

        void setMaxWordCandidatesCount(int maxWordCandidatesCount)
        Define the maximum number of word candidate. It count only the word candidates not taking into account the completion candidate.

        A new SingleCharWidgetApi#configure is needed after calling this method.

        In some cases (completion enabled and specific writing context), this value cannot be respected. *

        The default value is 3

        Parameters:
        maxWordCandidatesCount - The maximum of word candidate

      • setGesturesEnabled

        void setGesturesEnabled(boolean gesturesEnabled)
        Enable or disable the gesture recognition.

        It should be called before the configure.

        When set to true, you should add the "mul-lk-gesture.res" to recognize the carriage return gesture.

        Parameters:
        gesturesEnabled - Enable or disable the gesture recognition if true, disable if false

      • setCompletionEnabled

        void setCompletionEnabled(boolean completionEnabled)
        Enable or disable handwriting recognition completion.

        Handwriting recognition must be configured again for this setting to take effect. Note that enabling handwriting recognition completion significantly slows down handwriting recognition. This feature is disabled by default.

        Parameters:
        completionEnabled - Enable handwriting recognition completion if true, disable if false.
        See Also:
        configure(String, String[], byte[])

      • setSpeedQualityCompromise

        void setSpeedQualityCompromise(int speedQualityCompromise)
        Set speed/quality compromise of the handwriting recognition engine.

        Handwriting recognition must be configured again for this setting to take effect.

        Parameters:
        speedQualityCompromise - Speed/quality compromise rating.
        See Also:
        configure(String, String[], byte[])

      • setUserLexicon

        void setUserLexicon(String[] userLexicon)
        Set user lexicon (array of words) for handwriting recognition engine.

        Handwriting recognition must be configured again for this setting to take effect.

        Parameters:
        userLexicon - User lexicon.
        See Also:
        configure(String, String[], byte[])

      • setMaxResourcesSize

        void setMaxResourcesSize(int maxResourcesSize)
        Set maximum size of the handwriting resources cache.

        Handwriting recognition must be configured again for this setting to take effect.

        Parameters:
        maxResourcesSize - Maximum size of the cache in bytes.

      • clear

        void clear()
        Clear ink and text contained in the widget.

        This function does not call the text changed callback after the text has been updated.

      • setText

        void setText(String text)
        Set the text managed by this widget.

        This function calls the text changed callback synchronously after the text has been updated.

        Parameters:
        text - String representation of the text (may be null).
        See Also:
        SingleCharWidgetApi.OnTextChangedListener.onTextChanged(String, boolean)

      • getText

        String getText()
        Returns the text managed by this widget.
        Returns:
        String representation of the text.

      • setOnTextChangedListener

        void setOnTextChangedListener(SingleCharWidgetApi.OnTextChangedListener l)
        Register a callback to be invoked when the text changes.
        Parameters:
        l - The listener to attach to this widget.
        See Also:
        SingleCharWidgetApi.OnTextChangedListener

      • replaceCharacters

        void replaceCharacters(int start,
                     int end,
                     String text)
        Replace characters in the text.

        This function can be used to select an alternate handwriting recognition candidate for any word or character. The specified character range shall span a word or a single character, and the provided replacement text shall be one of the possible candidates to trigger a word or character candidate change.

        Characters may be inserted at any location in the text by calling this function with the same start and end character indices and a non-empty replacement string.

        Characters may be deleted from the text by calling this function with a non-empty characters range and an empty or null replacement string.

        This function calls the text changed callback synchronously after characters have been replaced.

        Parameters:
        start - Character index of the first character to replace.
        end - Character index past the last character to replace.
        text - Replacement text string (may be null).
        See Also:
        SingleCharWidgetApi.OnTextChangedListener.onTextChanged(String, boolean), getWordCandidates(int), getCharacterCandidates(int)

      • getWordCandidates

        CandidateInfo getWordCandidates(int index)
        Returns alternate candidate information for the word at specified index.

        This function computes the character range of the word at specified index, and provides alternate candidates and possible completions.

        Alternate candidates can be selected by calling the replaceCharacters(int, int, String) functions with parameters from the candidate information.

        Parameters:
        index - Character index within or before the word.
        Returns:
        Candidate information for the word at specified index or null if index is out of bounds.
        See Also:
        CandidateInfo, replaceCharacters(int, int, String)

      • getCharacterCandidates

        CandidateInfo getCharacterCandidates(int index)
        Returns alternate candidate information for the character at specified index.

        Alternate candidates can be selected by calling the replaceCharacters(int, int, String) functions with parameters from the candidate information.

        Parameters:
        index - Index of the specified character.
        Returns:
        Candidate information for the character at specified index or null if index is out of bounds.
        See Also:
        CandidateInfo, replaceCharacters(int, int, String)

      • setInsertIndex

        void setInsertIndex(int index)
        Set the index of the insertion point.
        Parameters:
        index - Character index of the insertion point.

      • getInsertIndex

        int getInsertIndex()
        Returns the index of the insertion point.
        Returns:
        Character index of the insertion point.

      • setOnGestureListener

        void setOnGestureListener(SingleCharWidgetApi.OnGestureListener l)
        Register callbacks to be invoked when gestures are detected.
        Parameters:
        l - The listener to attach to this widget.
        See Also:
        SingleCharWidgetApi.OnGestureListener

      • configure

        void configure(String language,
             String[] resources,
             byte[] certificate)
        Configure the handwriting recognition engine to use the MyScript Builder engine running on the device.

        This function is non-blocking and returns immediately.

        Configuration is a lengthy process that may take up to several seconds, depending on the handwriting resources to be configured. It is recommended to setup a configuration listener to detect the end of the configuration process.

        When the device is rotated, Android completely recreates the UI without restarting the process of the application. After the device has been rotated, you need to configure the new instance of SingleCharWidgetApi by calling this function again.

        Parameters:
        language - Handwriting recognition language (locale).
        resources - Array of paths to handwriting resource files.
        certificate - Byte array containing the handwriting recognition certificate.
        See Also:
        SingleCharWidgetApi.OnConfigureListener

      • configureRemote

        void configureRemote(String language,
                   String mode,
                   String apiKey)
        Reserved for internal use.

      • setOnConfigureListener

        void setOnConfigureListener(SingleCharWidgetApi.OnConfigureListener l)
        Register a callback to be invoked at the beginning and end of a configuration process.
        Parameters:
        l - The listener to attach to this widget.
        See Also:
        SingleCharWidgetApi.OnConfigureListener

      • getErrorCode

        int getErrorCode()
        Return an error code describing the error that happened during the configuration, if any.
        Returns:
        Error code describing the error or 0 if no error.

      • getErrorString

        String getErrorString()
        Return a string describing the error that happened during the configuration, if any.
        Returns:
        String describing the error.
